metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:user_sid55_test is properly supported.
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:user_sid55_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.
Information regarding the users on your particular machine can be found by navigating to Start -> Run... and by typing 'mmc' and adding the Local Users and Groups Snap-in.

criterion.comment: Test that a user_sid55_object is supported.
Test that a user_sid55_object pattern match is supported.
Test that a user_sid55_object not equals is supported.

user_sid55_test.comment: Test that a user_sid55_object is supported.
Test that a user_sid55_object pattern match is supported.
Test that a user_sid55_object not equals is supported.

user_sid55_object.comment: This object represents a user_sid55_object where the user_sid matches the regular expression '^S-1-5-21-[-0-9]+-500$' or the administrator account.
This object represents a user_sid55_object where the user_sid matches the regular expression '.*'.
This object represents a user_sid55_object where the user_sid is not equal to 'S-1-5-18'.

user_sid55_state.comment: This user_sid55_state represents a user_sid55_object where the user_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-domain-500', the administrator account, and the account is enabled.'.
This user_sid55_state represents a user_sid55_object where the user_sid matches the regular expression '.*'.
This user_sid55_state represnets a user_sid55_object where the user_sid is not equal to 'S-1-5-18'.
